subject: Writing
title: Walter Cronkite: The Most Trusted Man
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Walter Cronkite: The Most Trusted Man.

hook.text: A 1972 poll found Americans trusted Walter Cronkite more than any politician, preacher, or professor.

buildup.text: Cronkite anchored the CBS Evening News for 19 years, becoming the voice of American television news.

discovery.text: He announced JFK's assassination, covered the Moon landing, and reported from Vietnam.

twist.text: When Cronkite called Vietnam a stalemate on air, Johnson knew the war's public support was finished.

climax.text: He proved that a journalist's credibility is built slowly and can move nations when used wisely.

punchline.text: Trust made his words weigh more than any headline.

quiz.question: Why was Walter Cronkite called 'the most trusted man in America'?
options: Polls showed he was trusted more than any public figure
He won the most journalism awards
